nodes.bodyText: WebAppClientsProperties
Use name like WebApiClientRegistrationRepository, WebAppClientRegistrationRepository
Use name like AADWebAppOAuth2AuthorizedClientRepository, AADWebApiOAuth2AuthorizedClientRepository
Not necessary to create a new class.
Let's use authorization instead, we won't use two sets of properties for webapi and webapp seperately.

nodes.bodyText: Can we use InMemoryClientRegistrationRepository instead of create AADOboClientRegistrationRepository?
@wujack778  I think we could use InMemoryClientRegistrationRepository directly since we don't have special logic in the client registration repo here.
Can we assert the value instead of assert size?
sure
I think AAD_PROPERTY_PREFIX is not necessary.
fine
After discuss with jialin, we think shorter name will make code easier to read. So I suggest to rename inMemoryClientRegistrationRepository to repository

Suggestions:

Reuse this part of code.
Add tenantId in AuthorizationServerEndpoints, just like baseUri.
Consider whether we need endSessionEndpoint for resource server.

It's OK to to these in another PR.
@wujack778 are we addressing this comment in the current PR?
No ,I didn't fully understand what he meant , Maybe next PR?
@wujack778 please talk with @chenrujun then. It's okay to do that refactor in another PR.
all right.

please talk with @chenrujun then. It's okay to do that refactor in another PR.

nodes.bodyText: Rename aadJwtBearerTokenAuthenticationConverter to converter.
Same here.
Same here.
Same here.

User.read -> User.Read. R should be upper case.
scope value should have prefix. i.e. it should be http://xxx/User.Read
It's better use more than one scope to test. Like xxx.scopes=xxx/User.Read, xxx/User.Write.
Why is it better to use more than one scope to test?
@saragluna  So we can test whether all scopes take effect.
But how do we achieve that in the unit test?
get it.

@chenrujun I see what you're trying to say here. If we have no special logic here and it's just spring doing the parsing, so the array of one element or two elements doesn't make that much difference to me. But we could do with two elements here.
